column4: I can't get my laptop resolution down to 1440x900, it will only display 1680! please help! I'm using nvidia drivers and xinerama - here is my xorg.conf: http://pastebin.ca/1257865
check line 100 and 112
add the res you want to the left of the modes list
no go, i updated the pastebin, please have a look: http://pastebin.ca/1257879
what is your desired res?
when i launch nvidia-settings, it wont give me any other option but 1680
left laptop monitor: 1440x900 - right external monitor 1680x1050
do you have any ideas for me? im beating myself up over hear
all i know is have the single res you want and no other, it should force it
does dpkg -l | grep gedit     show anything?
then wassup?
they are the same thing, that menu item launches synaptic
no menu item launched gnome-app-install
then edit the item to launch gksudo synaptic
thats not a solution
why isnt it? both programs allow use of a gui to emove and install apps.
im looking for a valid reason as the why the app list is empty and a valid solution not 'Just make it like to a similar app'
try: sudo apt-get --reinatll install gnome-app-install
the command will reinstall the installer app and may sort things out for you
i owe you one that worked! Sorry if I snapped at you earlier, i just woke up :)
np man
i dont use either, i use apt, gui takes too long
